channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Microsoft brings Windows restore to more enterprise devices - so you don't have to worry about continuous backups
item.description: Windows Backup for Organizations now prompts users at first sign-in to reinstate previous settings and app configurations.

item.title: On s'est trompés sur le champ magnétique de la Lune depuis Apollo : voici ce qu'on vient de comprendre
item.description: Les roches d’Apollo racontent une histoire inattendue : il y a 3,5 milliards d’années, la Lune aurait brièvement généré un champ magnétique presque aussi intense que celui de la Terre. Comment un si petit astre a-t-il pu produire une telle puissance ? Une nouvelle étude avance une réponse.

item.title: Nintendo urges Switch 2 players to install Resident Evil Requiem's day-one patch to address several fixes
item.description: Nintendo has suggested that Switch 2 users install Resident Evil Requiem's day-one patch, which is said to contain "several fixes" before returning to Racoon City.

item.title: Why ‘Star Wars’ Is the Franchise Ryan Gosling Finally Landed On
item.description: The 'Project Hail Mary' star has, for the most part, avoided large franchises. That changes with 2027's 'Star Wars: Starfighter.'

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein saw promise in Bitcoin — and its far-right supporters
item.description: The tranche of Jeffrey Epstein emails and files released on January 30th tie the infamous pedophile, sex trafficker, and influence peddler to elite figures across the tech industry. The world of cryptocurrency is no exception. Epstein's connections are intriguing, disturbing - and worth mapping closely. With his interest first piqued as early as 2011, Epstein […]...

item.title: A cheap MacBook is the perfect way for Apple to win over Windows users
item.description: The MacBook is coming back — or at least, that's what the rumors claim. Next week, Apple is expected to announce a colorful, low-cost, non-Air, non-Pro MacBook powered by one of its mobile processors. By avoiding its pricier M-series chips, Apple may reportedly be able to reach a low $699 or $799 price for the MacBook. The $999 MacBook Air is the cheapest laptop on the company's website right now, but Apple also sold the older M1 MacBook Air at Walmart for $700 in 2024, which later went down to $650 last year.That Walmart deal was a smart way for Apple to test out the viability of cheaper MacB...

item.title: Pokémon Presents live build-up: all the announcements from the show as the franchise celebrates its 30th anniversary
item.description: Tune into our live coverage of the Pokémon Presents showcase. We'll post about each and every announcement as it happens.

item.title: Monter un PC gaming : nos recommandations des configurations PC gamer pour tous les budgets
item.description: Monter soi-même son PC de bureau gamer est la solution idéale pour avoir un équipement qui correspond parfaitement à ses besoins. Pour vous aider dans cette tâche, Frandroid vous accompagne pas à pas en vous conseillant les meilleurs composants pour la configuration PC gamer qu'il vous faut.

item.title: Aventon Soltera 3 Electric Bike Review: A Fun Hybrid Single-Speed
item.description: Aventon’s latest single-speed hybrid bicycle is light, looks cool, and is the most bikey electric bike on the market right now.

item.title: I've never considered buying a hi-res MP3 player, but this new A&K DAP has a feature so handy, I'm changing my mind
item.description: The first hi-res audio player with built-in hearing tests just landed and if I could afford it, I’d be first in line

item.title: Ce robot aspirateur-laveur Xiaomi puissant qui vous tend littéralement les bras ne dépasse pas les 230 €
item.description: Puissant, intelligent et doté de deux bras mécaniques extensibles, le Xiaomi Robot Vacuum S40 Pro est un aspirateur robot 2-en-1 bien complet. Et moins cher que la plupart de ses concurrents : actuellement, PC Componentes le propose à 225,99 euros au lieu de 299,99 euros.

item.title: Trend Micro warns of worrying security flaw allowing full Windows takeover, so patch now
item.description: Two critical-severity flaws in Apex One, with Trend Micro advising users to apply the patch now.

item.title: ‘The tariffs and pandemic crisis seem a joke compared to this’: Cheap phones could be gone forever thanks to the RAM crisis, a new report claims
item.description: The smartphone market could be forever changed by the RAM crisis, says a new report — and Android could be hit particularly badly.

item.title: God of War: Sons of Sparta players can now unlock the two-player, endgame roguelike challenge by entering a code on their DualSense
item.description: Gods of War: Sons of Sparta's toughest endgame challenge, which also offers a two-player challenge mode, can now be unlocked before beating the main game.

item.title: Free RPG Where Winds Meet is already hundreds of hours long, but it's about to get even bigger thanks to a massive new expansion that adds a huge desert to explore and fearsome bosses to defeat
item.description: The massive Where Winds Meet Hexi expansion drops next week with a whole new region and loads of new things to do.

item.title: No, that budget laptop doesn't have 1.1TB of storage — watch out for this shady trick some Amazon sellers are trying
item.description: PSA: watch out for this shady practice with cheap laptops that appear to have 1.1TB or 1.2TB of storage — they absolutely don't.

item.title: Samsung confirms that the Galaxy S26 series is bringing satellite communications to users globally — here's how it could work
item.description: It's been rumored for a while, but Samsung is finally adding full satellite connectivity to its flagship phones.

item.title: Ultrahuman’s new flagship smart ring has a 15-day battery
item.description: Ultrahuman is expanding its health monitoring ecosystem with the launch of a new flagship smart ring and a "biointelligence AI" platform upgrade. The Ring Pro is Ultrahuman's third-generation smart ring, and promises up to 15 days of battery life before needing to recharge, alongside 250 days of on-device health history storage. Those are some significant […]...

item.title: Ultrahuman’s new Pro ring comes with 15 days battery life
item.description: If there’s one thing that stops people using their smart rings over the long term, it’s the battery life. After all, they’re so unobtrusive, it’s easy to forget to drop it on the charging plate every few days. It doesn’t take long for your pricey gadget to become little more than a very expensive piece of jewelry. It’s one of many maladies Ultrahuman is looking to address with the advent of its new Pro, a smart ring boasting up to 15 days of battery life. It even ships with a fancy battery case, which itself includes enough power to last it 45 days, making it easier to keep re-charged on the g...

item.title: The Full ‘Faces of Death’ Trailer Is Here to Eagerly Give You the Ick
item.description: The provocative cult mockumentary gets a modern update in Daniel Goldhaber's remake, opening April 10.

item.title: The Strangest Beliefs of Our Likely Next Surgeon General
item.description: Casey Means has criticized the birth control pill, fearmongered about vaccines, and touted supplements with weak evidence behind them.

item.title: Huxe Will Give You a Personalized, Daily Audio Summary Powered by AI
item.description: The app reads your email inbox and your meeting calendar, then gives you a short audio summary. It can help you spend less time scrolling, but of course, there are privacy drawbacks to consider.

item.title: Aktiia Hilo Blood Pressure Monitor Review: Cuffless BP Tracking
item.description: The Aktiia Hilo Blood Pressure Monitor is the first cuffless monitor to be cleared by the FDA. It’s discreet, highly accurate, and simple to use

item.title: Notes from a Burmese Prison
item.description: This story is a comic by Danny Fenster and Amy Kurzweil and is not compatible with RSS readers. But you can (and should) read it at The Verge’s website.

item.title: Phones are going to get weird next week
item.description: With rare exceptions, phones are pretty boring these days. The good news is, a boatload of those rare exceptions are about to show up at once, courtesy of Mobile World Congress. The tech industry's biggest mobile show may not quite have the clout it once did, when the likes of Samsung, Sony, LG, and HTC […]

item.title: 'To get something to last for 15 days took us months of engineering effort' — Ultrahuman CEO breaks silence on the long-rumored Ring Pro, its next Oura rival
item.description: Ultrahuman is finally launching its Ring PRO wearing fitness and health-tracking ring.

item.title: Is AI driving away your best customers? 3 fixes for bridging gaps with growth audiences
item.description: Bad data is a universal problem, but the lack of situational intelligence in our AI systems hits growth audiences—like Black consumers—first and hardest. It’s the last week of Black History Month (BHM) and it’s clear Americans are over performative values. Trite BHM-inspired merchandise sits on retailer shelves untouched while media is abuzz covering the artistry, activism, and symbolism of Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime show. The signal is clear: consumers are looking to brands for real solutions to real problems, not products that commodify culture....

item.title: MWC 2026: all the phones, gadgets, and announcements from Barcelona
item.description: The Verge is heading to Barcelona, Spain, for Mobile World Congress, the biggest phone show of the year. CES may dominate the headlines when it comes to TVs, computer components, and AI inanity, but for all things mobile, MWC has it beat. Since it’s a global show, that includes all manner of announcements of phones, […]

item.title: Fuite massive de données médicales, les notes glaçantes des médecins sur leurs patients exposées sur la toile
item.description: Le vol de données médicales de l'éditeur Cegedim prend une tournure dramatique. Des commentaires extrêment intimes laissés par les médecins se retrouvent désormais à la vue de tous sur Internet.

item.title: Qu’est-ce qui clocherait dans le rachat de Warner Bros. par Paramount Skydance ?
item.description: Dernier coup de théâtre dans la guerre aux enchères opposant Netflix à Paramount pour le rachat de Warner Bros. Discovery ! Le leader de la SVoD a annoncé ne pas surenchérir face à la dernière offre de Paramount et semble jeter l'éponge. Pourtant, un rachat de Warner par Paramount ne serait pas une si bonne nouvelle.

item.title: Ce moniteur Samsung incurvé 4K de 32 pouces s’offre plus de 160 euros de réduciton
item.description: Sur Amazon, vous pourrez retrouver le Samsung U32R592CWP pour 203,36 euros. Un moniteur Ultra HD de 32 pouces, idéal pour les télétravailleurs même si la connectique fait cruellement défaut.

item.title: Pourquoi les Samsung Galaxy S26 coûtent si cher, le constructeur avoue tout
item.description: Le constructeur sud-coréen confirme enfin ce que toute l'industrie redoutait. La flambée mondiale des prix de la mémoire est la principale responsable de la hausse tarifaire de ses nouveaux smartphones.

item.title: ‘Love Is Blind’ Embraces the Manosphere
item.description: A show that started as an earnest if messy quest for love is now simply a mirror to the hell of modern dating.

item.title: I gave my vintage lens collection a new lease of life with cheap lens adapters — here are my 9 favorites, starting from as little as $9
item.description: A cheap lens adapter can unlock a vast array of vintage lenses for modern mirrorless cameras — here are 9 options I recommend, for various mounts

item.title: Meet ‘Patty,’ Burger King’s new AI assistant that lives in employees’ headsets
item.description: Customers are already calling it ‘dystopian.’ At hundreds of Burger King restaurants across the U.S., there’s a new invisible worker who’s tracking which ingredients are in stock, analyzing daily sales data, and checking in on whether employees are saying “Thank you” and “You’re welcome.” It’s an AI assistant named Patty.

item.title: OpenAI will notify authorities of credible threats after Canada mass shooter's second account was discovered
item.description: OpenAI has vowed to strengthen its safety protocols and to notify law enforcement of credible threats sooner in a letter addressed to Canadian authorities, according to Politico and The Washington Post. If you’ll recall, Canadian politicians summoned the company’s leaders after reports came out that it didn’t notify authorities when it banned the account owned by the Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia mass shooting suspect back in 2025. Some of OpenAI’s leaders have already met with Candian officials, and British Columbia Premier David Eby said Sam Altman had also agreed to meet with him. While O...

item.title: Xbox améliore votre expérience de jeu avec le streaming en 1440p
item.description: Microsoft déploie une nouvelle mise à jour pour les possesseurs de Xbox. Cette dernière offre une nouvelle qualité de streaming tout en fluidifiant l’expérience de jeu sur PC, mais également sur la ROG Xbox Ally.

item.title: iPhone and iPad approved by NATO for up to “restricted” level of classified data - 'a level of government certification no other consumer mobile device has met'
item.description: iPhones and iPads running iOS 26 and later become the first consumer devices approved to handle NATO Restricted data.

item.title: Five myths about sovereign cloud that could put your business at risk
item.description: As governments deploy AI, control and jurisdiction matter as much as where data is hosted.
